Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: voconnor2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is disgusting. The showers leak. Power goes off for hours at a time. Reservations made months in advance are confused. Rooms reak of cigarette smoke. Staff is rude and unable to answer simple questions. I have nothing good to say about this place. It has gone so far downhill that travellers should look carefully before booking into this place.

Reviews.Title: “As good as you will find for the money”
Reviews.Author: HAM45
Reviews.Content: Overall good value for money for a budget hotel.The two males on reception when we arrived were not very friendly or helpful, however two girls were nice and helpful, as was the lady who cleaned the rooms.Room was clean and comfortable and bathroom and shower clean. Location was great, right next to Termini with lots of good bars and cafes with friendly staff although there were lots of beggars about. Best thing was location worst was the 5% added to our bill for paying by card which we were not aware of and which added £31 to our bill, quite a bit when you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: Maan_L
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here over night as we had to catch the train early the next morning... The staff weren't overly friendly and we were taken from the reception to down another corridor up a lift to our room. It wasn't dirty it, but it wasn't very nice, the bed was hard - although a lot of beds in Italy are hard... The area did feel quite unsafe - I wouldn't have wanted to stay there longer than 1 night - I think breakfast was included but we weren't told where to go to get it and we just wanted to leave in the morning any way. I wouldn't staty there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible expwrience”
Reviews.Author: Dimitris78
Reviews.Content: Hotel was awful,very rude stuff,extremely dirty room with terrible smell,the mirror was broken and the stuff replied "yes but you can see yourself". You must avoid this hotel even if its your last choice.

Reviews.Title: “great location but felt very uneasy and unsafe”
Reviews.Author: consultanttravel
Reviews.Content: The breakfast which was supposed to be included in the rate was just a coffee or juice and a croissant in a travel cafe up the road !!! Every movement was monitored on a close circuit Tv which made us feel very uncomfortable as I think they monitored the inside of the rooms as well

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and with bad staff”
Reviews.Author: Tales82
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel because is near fron Roma Termini. This is the only advantage. The price is high for what the hotel offers. The floor was so dirty that my feet could get black after a few minutes walking on it. There was no hot water in the shower during the day, only at night. The street is noisy. The attendant was not very polite I noticed early, and later I saw him bitting (strongly) a little child in the reception. When my check out time came at 12h, I was on the shower (cold water) and the maid started to hit my door for minutes until I screamed for her to wait for just ten minutes. I didn´t like it, not at all.

Reviews.Title: “If you want bare bones, this is it”
Reviews.Author: sassiecat050
Reviews.Content: The Milazzo is one of several hotels in the same building, close to Roma Termini - which is actually its best feature. The lobby is one one floor and the few rooms are two floors up. some have called this 2nd and 4th floors, but in Europe where what Americans refer to the first floor is called the ground floor, the lobby and rooms are on floors 1 and 3 respectively. The room was clean, and almost everything in it worked. However, rain the morning after our arrival took of the satellite system, which never came back on. There was no phone. There was no hair dryer & a request to the lobby got a reply that we could have it when some one else returned it. They had no adaptor plug available (we had a converter) There was no literature in the room whatever of the sort that would give information on possible services, emergency information, etc. The breakfast that came with the room was not at a cafe next door - the cafe was across the street, around the corner and several doors down. Breakfast consisted of one beverage and one pastry. In addition to our hotel, the others in the building seemed to have a clientel that varied from youthful backpackers to middle-aged and older. For our last couple or days in Rome, we switched to a hotel on the Via Cavour, equally close to Roma Termini at not that much more of a price, but with amenities (like a working phone) that appeal to my sense of safety. When we went to the lobby at check out & attempted to cancel the reservation we had for our return to Rome in a couple of weeks, the request was denied and we were told we had to cancel via the same website we had used to book the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super close to the Termini”
Reviews.Author: MoondogNY
Reviews.Content: Practically a block from the Eastern entrace to the train station so getting there with bags was very easy. The building was rather dumpy but the room was clean and modern. The room itself was tiny (very old school) but the fixtures and the room and bathroom were newly renovated. TV's in the rooms but no internet access or phones. It was 100 Euro a night for not much by way of services, so I wish it was cheaper but it's Roma so what can you do. The restaurants nearby were very, very reasonable and felt safe walking around. It's a long, long walk to the Colloseum or Trevi Fountain but the subway is just under the train station so you can get to the Vatican easily. The night and early morning staff (non-Italian) were friendly and helpful. My only peev is that the morning/day (past 9am) were not so and they claimed that they had technical difficulties with their credit card machine so I had to pay with cash. This was annoying since I e-mailed them before I arrived to ask if they took credit cards and they said they did. I would probably stay here again if I could not find a cheaper place closer to the Coloseum. We stayed during the Rome Film Festival so many of the hotels were booked already.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Milazzo
HotelInfo.Address: Via Milazzo, 3, 00185 Rome, Italy
